sentences: yes they have a steal toe but they have a tag on them that reads `` important warningtheae shoes ( boots ) have been designed and manufactured as , and , for use as fashion footwear only .

they are not for use as safety footwear , and should not under any circumstances be worn as safety footwear ... `` a warning is also stitched into the inside of the boot near the heal that reads `` non-safty footear `` i am a little let down that this fact is not listed in the products description .
the reason i purchased these boots for work and they do not meet the required safety standard .
i got black ankle high boots like i wore back in the 90 's.. these do n't come close to the quality they had when they were made in uk.. just like everything else , cheaply made shoe from china .
leather is very thin & sole is super soft unlike the way they were made .
they are okay boots but very sad to see quality going into the crapper along with everything now made in china.. i 'd pay $ 200 .
00 for quality boots vs. $ 125 .
00 for junk..
so i order this shoe is such high hopes , shipping was fast so thats a plus .
now my issue with this boots were that they came without any type of cushioning ?
i did n't cared much but after i tried them on i heard a horrible squeak coming out of them .
i concluded that the tongue was the issue .
anyways i returned them for a pair of dr martens saltaire st boots .
this was 2 years ago so hopefully this classic boots changed that .
i purchased the black steel toe boots .
when they arrived , the little piece inside the shoe that goes at the heel had fallen off .
there was some dried glue where it was supposed to have been .
i just stuck it back but seriously ?
i was sort of disappointed but other than that the boots were in good condition .
they are comfortable after breaking them in !
got these bad boys for christmas .
took awhile to break them in but am so glad i did .
very comfortable , and i also feel tough with the steel toe .
good for the snow too .
would recommend for anyone who wants traditional and sturdy dr. martens .
advertised as leather , but is in fact a cloth backed synthetic !
maybe it 's a dm knock off .
it is a cheap , but not inexpensive boot .
i returned my pair due to the misleading representation .
i never put them on and only listed `` fit as expected `` because it was obligatory to write the review .
beware !
these things while they look the same , are not .
the leather is a less finished product , a cheaper leather that is not soft at all .
all in all , not near what they were back when they were made in england .
made in china ... sums it up .
the other reviews were right -- docs are not as comfortable as they were back when i wore them in high school .
the leather looks cheaper , and it 's taking longer to break them in .
they look great , seem to be well made , however , is a little tight across the top of foot where the tongue is sewn to the top of boot .
it is painful at the moment , but will power through in hopes of breaking them in and thus be able to enjoy for a long time .
these steel toe boots are great .
need them for work .
they are very comfortable and provide the protection i need .
will buy same thing again when and if these wear out .

sentences: i guess i thought the name `` lasticity `` and the description of the stretch of this boot , led me to believe that it would fit a wider calf .
i could not even zip this boot up and it did not have much stretch to it at all !
i have about a 17 `` calf so for those of you ladies with larger calf sizes ... this boot is not for you !
it also appears to be a taller boot , but i would say it is barely mid-calf .
otherwise , it is a nice looking boot for the price .
disappointed !
i learned the hard way that the brand name `` aerosoles `` does not always mean comfort .
i loved the style and tried to use shoe stretch spray and wear multiple socks to loosen the grip of the shoe around the width of my feet for a week or so to no avail .
also , the sole of the boot was very rigid and unforgiving to the the arches of my feet , thus major uncomfort pursued my body .
these boots have a sturdy , comfortable sole with a heel that is easy to walk on and ample toe room , but beyond that , i am disappointed .
the material is very thin and flimsy ( do n't expect the shaft to hold up like it does in the picture -- it sagged and wrinkled on my thin calves , leaving a huge gap between the shaft and my leg ) .
in short , if you 're looking for comfort , affordability , and have the calves to fill these out , they are a reasonably attractive boot .
but do n't expect anything beyond that .
given the thin quality of the material , i doubt these boots would last long .
i really love the boots mainly because the bottom of the boots have traction for bad weather which is one of the things i was looking for .
they also fit my small calves , i have a little room but that is okay .
and they have a little shine that is natural and i like that .
they are really comfortable and i can wear them to work and not have to take them off all day .
i have worn them a lot since i purchased them because of the weather here in d.c .
( cold/snow/wet ) .
they are one of my best purchases .
thank you .
i bought these boots to wear to my job as a high school teacher .
i read many reviews touting the comfort of these boots and they were not lying .
i have worn them all day - i mean from 7 am until 9pm - and my feet do not hurt at all .
the soles are not hard either , which helps in the maine winter .
they do not slide easily as many soles tend to do on snow .
i would buy these boots again .
they fit snuggly around the heel and leg , but not too much so .
just enough to stay up , i think .
some reviews indicated they were a bit tight ; however , i have no issues .
i am not overweight , but have athletic calves .
they fit me fine .
great boots for the money !
i had such high hopes for these boots after reading all the great reviews .
i am an average sized gal and have never had a problem zipping up boots , but these were way too narrow in the foot and the shaft .
i wear a size 8 or 8 .
5 normally .
i ordered the 8 and could n't zip them up even half way , plus the actual foot part was too narrow .
i do n't think going up half a size would have fixed the narrow width or the the narrow shaft , so i just returned them for a refund .
i was really hoping these boots would be cute , based on some other reviewers .
but when i got them and tried them on , i was surprised that they were loose around my calves - usually boots are tight on me in that area .
not only that , but the ankle area was really flimsy , and collapsed in an unattractive way .
had to return them .

too big and baggy on my skinny calves .

they seems comfy but were clearly very cheaply made .

these are very comfortable & attractive boots for my office environment .
i bought them before a trip to chicago & found them to be very dry , but that they would not protect my feet from the cold enough for long walks .
the aerosoles sole is just like on their shoes - which is fairly thin .
the uppers fit my calf well ( in recent years most boot uppers have been too wide for my leg ) .
i only wish that they were leather .
another positive was the lack of break-in time .
wore them 10 hours on the first day .
i really love these boots .
they fit perfectly and they are very comfortable .
i can wear them all day at work and my feet do not hurt at all .
i am so glad that i found these !

sentences: these boots look good and fit great , they have a nice thick sole with good tread .
i thought i had finally found the perfect pair of boots .
then the second time i wore them both feet leaked .
what 's the point of rainboots that do n't keep your feet dry ?
big waste of money .
next time i 'm going to ll bean .
so , i bought these shoes and they were fine .
hardly wore them , but it 's been two years and i had to go back to my reliable ll beane duck boots because these chooka 's split after sitting in a humidified room for two years .
buyer beware .
i buy my shoes to last .
this boots appeared great but too small .

plus the insole was oversized and would have to be trimmed .
i am disappointed because they looked and felt like great boots .

i would not deal with this seller again .

however my roommate who is a half to full size smaller says it fits great for her .
so definitely order up !
although some other reviews scared me before buying this product , i am very pleased with my new rain boots .
they fit very comfortably , even with thicker socks .
i really like the buckle and think it gives the boots some cute flair .
i definitely recommend this product to anyone who wants to have high-quality rain boots without paying an absurd about of money .
great fit , however my socks were soaked the first time i wore them out in the rain .

if you 're looking for rainboots , definitely go for better ones than these .

sentences: i bought these shoes from comet shoes on amazon.com and wore it 2 times before the seam came apart from the sole .
all this after just 2 regular wears ... not even a strenuous hike !
i suspect comet shoes is are selling counterfeit products because merrell shoes are more reliable .
i would not be surprised if other sellers are following a similar practice .
i filed a complain about this was told there 's nothing you can do to help because it 's been 90 days since my purchase .
it 's shameful that they only look at the date of sale and not the usage before making a refund decision .

these are extremely comfortable boots , i did order a half size larger , i love them ; however , i bought them in february and by april the inside fabric of the heel area of my right boot is torn and falling apart .
obviously , a poorly made shoe or inferior materials .
i liked these shoes for the fit and comfort .
they were waterproof at first , but after wearing them for a few months they became quite leaky .
so if you need something waterproof you should probably look elsewhere .
i have hard to fit feet since i need orthotics .
these are a little smaller than i 'd like , but generally ok .
i like the heel support and the height is just right to provide support without rubbing .
mainly i need walking shoes that are waterproof and so far they 've been ok , walking through wet grass , although have n't had a chance to try them in rain ( keeps raining at night ! )
the color is nice , more light blue than purple .
i 've tried the shoes in stores but neither had the size i needed .
i was super delighted to discover amazon was selling a third color ( grey/blue ) at the same price .
so with prime membership and tax-free , it was a done deal !
also , you will need to buy a 0 .
5 size bigger if you want to have a little bit of room after hiking for hours .
otherwise , the size that you would normally wear would be quite snug .
the shoes also needed to be broken into , but i survived my first hike this past weekend with very minor blisters .
it 's very sturdy and helped steady my ankles ( i rolled them a lot when i just wore running shoes ) .
great shoes for hiking in all kinds of weather , that protects your feet and keep them warm .
thanks !
i purchased these hiking boots specifically because they claimed to be waterproof .
the boot even has a little tag on the side indicating so .
apparently merrell is very proud of it .
long story short , they are anything but waterproof .
even water-resistant would be too generous .
as my husband aptly put it , porous is the term that best describes the material .
walking through dewy grass for more than a couple of minutes will leave your feet soaking wet .
the seams let water penetrate immediately , which i found out after walking through a shallow puddle .
the boot does not perform any better at repelling water than my sandals .
it is that bad .
a complete waste of money if you purchase these with the intention of keeping your feet dry .
i 'm not crazy about these boots .
they are very uncomfortable in the foot bed .
i ca n't imagine wearing these shoes to go hiking in .
my feet would be killing me .
sorry to say , they went back .
i have worn merrell hiking boots for maybe 20 years .
this would be my fourth of fifth pair .
although they are somewhat comfortable to wear for walking , my feet hurt after short level ground hikes .
they rubbed on both sides of the toe area where my feet are wide ( and why i buy merrell boots ) .
i did not break them in and that could be a factor .
they are light weight and look good , but i am disappointed in the discomfort .
i bought these shoes just before a trip to niagara falls and had them shipped overnight .
thank goodness i read the suggestions by other reviewers to order 1/2 size up bacause these shoes definately run small .
i ordered a 9 , usually wear an 8 ?
1/2 , and i could possibly have ordered a 9 ?
1/2 because my toe is at the end of the shoe ( but not cramped enough for me to be unable to wear them ) .
that being said , these shoes really are comfortable with no break in time required .
i took them straight out of the box and wore them to walk all around niagara falls without any discomfort .
and they are waterproof !
i tested it by wearing them on the maid of the mist boat ride to the bottom of the falls .
i got soaked but my feet stayed dry !
i would definately recommend these shoes to anyone and i 'm considering getting another pair for myself !
these boots are awesome !
they are perfect for being on your feet all day and are amazingly waterproof .
my feet never get wet even when the outside of the boots are soaked .
i bought supports with them initially because i have high arches but i did n't even end up needing them , they provided adequate support themselves .
definitely worth the money .
